company: Regional Medical Center of San Jose
description:
Description

SHIFT: Days (rotating weekends)
SCHEDULE: Full-time


Regional Medical Center of San Jose is a 264 bed acute care hospital with a Level II Trauma Center. The hospital provides a host of technologically advanced services including Cardiovascular, Neuro, Orthopedic, Bariatric and General Surgery, Interventional Pulmonology and services for Women. Regional holds Joint Commission advanced certification as a Comprehensive Stroke Center and a Get with the Guidelines- Stroke Gold Plus Performance Achievement Award from the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. County-designated STEMI (heart attack) Receiving Center designated Lung Cancer Screening Center, a member of Extracorporeal Life Support Organization (ECMO) and certified by The Joint Commission in Sepsis care. 

 

Our Clinical Lab Scientist teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. We have a passion for creating positive patient interactions. If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise! 

 

SCHEDULE: 1.0 (40 hours per week), SHIFT: Days with rotating weekends.

 

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Pathologists and Laboratory Managers, the Clinical Lab Scientist I performs, as assigned, all technical, analytical, clerical, and quality assurance tasks and duties associated with laboratory testing.

Qualifications

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: California Dept. of Health Services CLS License


EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: Ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Good judgment, common sense.  Ability to assume initiative for prompt

and accurate performance of tests with appropriate documentation and notification of abnormal results.  Ability to work under routine and stressful conditions in an accurate and timely manner.           

Preferred: 6 months or more experience as Clinical Laboratory Scientist or Clinical Laboratory Scientist intern in a hospital setting.   ASCP-certified Medical Technologist.

 

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: 4-year College degree in Biological Sciences (BA or BS)

 

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

Minimum:   Ability to read, write, and converse in English.  Strong organizational skills.  Advanced math and chemistry/biology knowledge. Practical and current knowledge in all

appropriate laboratory disciplines. Basic Phlebotomy skills. Basic computer skills.

Preferred:   Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.

We offer you an excellent total compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefit package and growth opportunities. We believe in our team and your ability to do excellent work with us. Your benefits include 401k, PTO medical, dental, flex spending, life, disability, tuition reimbursement, employee discount program, employee stock purchase program and student loan repayment. We would love to talk to you about this fantastic opportunity.

Hospital Corporation of America (HCA) is a community of 94,000 Registered Nurses and 38,000 active physicians. We have over 1,900 facilities ranging from hospitals, freestanding ER’s, ambulatory surgery centers, and urgent care clinics. Our facility-based staff continues to raise the bar in patient care. Ten HCA hospitals have been named in IBM Watson Health’s top 100 best-performing hospitals based on patient satisfaction and operational data.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

 Are you ready to help us make the future?

Join our newly formed Honeywell Robotics team and embark on an exciting journey to design novel Robots and Robotics Systems for deployment in Warehouse and Logistics sectors around the world. In this role you will architect, design, develop, integrate and test Industrial Robots in an Agile fashion. Our goal is to build and deploy plug-and-go robotic systems in Warehouse or Distribution Center environments. We also want you to help enable our sales and marketing teams to quickly assess customer opportunities and recommend realistic and workable Honeywell solutions both at the Robot and System level using prototypes to demonstrate clear business value.

To accomplish this objective, you will be integrating components from open source, universities, and partners into commercial robotic systems. This may require integrating sensors and sensor fusion, mechatronics, individual work items, environment, embedded digital control and Machine Learning Algorithms as well as the entire workflow interfacing to Honeywell’s Momentum or select third party Warehouse Execution Systems (WES). You will also collaborate with senior engineers to help develop the testing of Cloud Robotics technologies.

Key Responsibilities

  • Requirements and design
  • Software architecture and coding
  • Integration
  • Certification
  • Test
  • Feature Definition
  • Customer Support
  • Verification and Validation
  • Ability to code in multiple languages
  • Analytical skills & software development skills

YOU MUST HAVE

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Computer Science
  • Must be able to participate in a co-op prior to completing current degree program

WE VALUE

  • Knowledge of software configuration management and change management practices
  • Diverse and global teaming and collaboration
  • Effective communicator
  • Wide degree of creativity and latitude
  • Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done, do things before being asked by others or forced to by events.
  • Ability to consistently make timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness.
  • Can quickly analyze, incorporate and apply new information and concepts.
  • Industrial robotics experience such as Fanuc, Motoman/Yaskawa, ABB, Kuka etc.
  • Experience developing in C, C++ and Python.
  • Experience with Linux: Ubuntu

Honeywell Intelligrated is a leading, single-source provider of automated material handling solutions and intelligent software that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers around the world. Through a broad portfolio of automation equipment, warehouse execution system software, services and support, our solutions give businesses a competitive edge in increasingly complex commerce and fulfillment environments

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K_UZCM7B9yk

Additional Information

  • JOB ID: req233220
  • Category: Engineering
  • Location: 2555 Smallman St, 2nd Fl,Pittsburgh,Pennsylvania,15222,United States
  • Nonexempt

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

More information about this job:

Overview:

We are a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM Global helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles.

 

FM Global has several rewarding and exciting full-time, 6-month, paid co-op opportunities to offer to students that are motivated to apply their classroom experience, professional demeanor, and personal ambition. You will get firsthand experience while earning college credits and getting paid!

 

FM Globals co-op opportunities are based at our corporate headquarters in Johnston, RI, which is part of the greater Providence area. With a large college-age population, Providence offers a vibrant arts and entertainment scene that includes local theatre and music, collegiate and minor league sporting events, great restaurants. Also, we are not that far from the beautiful RI beaches!


Responsibilities:

SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT: As a software development co-op, you will have the opportunity to work on real-world problems and solutions with a team of hardworking developers. Your projects may consist of developing or modifying business applications, integrating business applications and databases, augmenting rapid software delivery and deployment processes, and automating software testing processes.

Qualifications:

Skills we are seeking for the software development role:

  • Enrolled in Computer Science or related degree program
  • Theory and principles of software engineering
  • Fluency in high-level programming languages (including OOP), environments, and tools for computing
  • Knowledge of databases and computer operating systems and basic knowledge of networks
  • Ability to work effectively in teams and solve problems

FM Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to attracting, developing and retaining a diverse workforce.

position: Intern, Infrastructure Technical Project Management, Fall 2021
description:
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

We are currently seeking an Intern, Infrastructure Technical Project Management. This position requires an experienced professional with a passion for EV, and the ability to build out dashboards, and manage large-scale AWS infrastructure programs. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment. 

Role/Responsibilities:

  • Assist in managing large-scale AWS infrastructure programs, define milestones and success criteria, allocate resources, and deliver products on-time
  • Assist in following the agile methodologies using Scrum and Kanban 
  • Understand technical implementation at the architecture level and propose technical alternatives when necessary
  • Design metrics, reports and dashboards 
  • Influence technical decisions, and influence execution while working with large, cross-functional teams
  • Complement efforts to communicate schedules, priorities, and status to all levels in the company
  • Constantly communicate our vision, features, priorities, deliverables, and goals to our stakeholders via program documentation, launch announcements, release notes, brown bags, seminars, user trainings. 
  • Interface with engineering managers and engineers to estimate work efforts, define milestones and manage resources
  • Track progress, resolve dependencies, evaluate risks and communicate status to management and project stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in Python and Terraform 
  • Experience or theoretical knowledge of project Management on technical cross-functional projects
  • Experience in AWS infrastructure, data engineering, and business intelligence 
  • Great ability to identify and translate emerging trends and customer needs into workable product proposals
  • Solid technical aptitude and an ability to contribute to technical designs, challenges, and risks
  • Zeal to learn new things and make a difference 
  • Ability to prioritize multiple projects, and meet deadlines

Education:

  • Studying or completing Bachelor’s, Master’s, or equivalent experience in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field
  • Will consider undergrads Sophomore level and above: Associate’s, Bachelor’s, Post-Secondary 
  • Graduates are eligible for this internship up to 12 months after graduation 

Programming Timing:

  • Start Date: September 7th, 2021 
  • End Date: November 26th- December 23rd  
  • Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; end date is flexible based on individual needs
  • Some flexibility with start date is available as needed

Other:

  • Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start onsite for your first day of employment 
  • Availability: Full – Time is preferred  
  • Anticipated Hours: 8:30am – 5:30pm  
  • Work Environment: Mix - Split between: Office/ Lab/ Bay 
  • Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable. 
  • Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization.   
  • Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week.  
  • Housing: No compensation for housing.   
  • Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses.  
  • Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence.  
  • Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area.   
  • Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check. 
  • Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

company: Regional Medical Center of San Jose
description:
Description

SHIFT: PRN
SCHEDULE: PRN/Per Diem


Regional Medical Center of San Jose is a 264 bed acute care hospital with a Level II Trauma Center. The hospital provides a host of technologically advanced services including Cardiovascular, Neuro, Orthopedic, Bariatric and General Surgery, Interventional Pulmonology and services for Women. Regional holds Joint Commission advanced certification as a Comprehensive Stroke Center and a Get with the Guidelines- Stroke Gold Plus Performance Achievement Award from the American Heart Association/American Stroke Association. County-designated STEMI (heart attack) Receiving Center designated Lung Cancer Screening Center, a member of Extracorporeal Life Support Organization (ECMO) and certified by The Joint Commission in Sepsis care. 

 

Our Clinical Lab Scientist teams are a committed, caring group of colleagues. We have a passion for creating positive patient interactions. If you are dedicated to caring for the well-being of others, this could be your next opportunity. We want your knowledge and expertise! 

 

SCHEDULE: 0.001 (PRN-Per Diem), SHIFT: As Needed

 

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the direction of the Pathologists and Laboratory Managers, the Clinical Lab Scientist I performs, as assigned, all technical, analytical, clerical, and quality assurance tasks and duties associated with laboratory testing.

Qualifications

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: California Dept. of Health Services CLS License


EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: Ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Good judgment, common sense.  Ability to assume initiative for prompt

and accurate performance of tests with appropriate documentation and notification of abnormal results.  Ability to work under routine and stressful conditions in an accurate and timely manner.           

Preferred: 6 months or more experience as Clinical Laboratory Scientist or Clinical Laboratory Scientist intern in a hospital setting.   ASCP-certified Medical Technologist.

 

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum: 4-year College degree in Biological Sciences (BA or BS)

 

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

Minimum:   Ability to read, write, and converse in English.  Strong organizational skills.  Advanced math and chemistry/biology knowledge. Practical and current knowledge in all

appropriate laboratory disciplines. Basic Phlebotomy skills. Basic computer skills.

Preferred:   Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.

We offer you an excellent total compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefit package and growth opportunities. We believe in our team and your ability to do excellent work with us. Your benefits include 401k, PTO medical, dental, flex spending, life, disability, tuition reimbursement, employee discount program, employee stock purchase program and student loan repayment. We would love to talk to you about this fantastic opportunity.

Hospital Corporation of America (HCA) is a community of 94,000 Registered Nurses and 38,000 active physicians. We have over 1,900 facilities ranging from hospitals, freestanding ER’s, ambulatory surgery centers, and urgent care clinics. Our facility-based staff continues to raise the bar in patient care. Ten HCA hospitals have been named in IBM Watson Health’s top 100 best-performing hospitals based on patient satisfaction and operational data.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


Notice

Our Company’s recruiters are here to help unlock the next possibility within your career and we take your candidate experience very seriously. During the recruitment process, no recruiter or employee will request financial or personal information (Social Security Number, credit card or bank information, etc.) from you via email. The recruiters will not email you from a public webmail client like Gmail or Yahoo Mail. If you feel suspicious of a job posting or job-related email, let us know by clicking 

privacy@hcahealthcare.com

.

For questions about your job application or this site please contact HCAhrAnswers at 1-844-422-5627 option 1.

position: Summer 2021 - Customer Technology; Social Care and Digital Analytics
description:
Requisition ID:  65330 

Job Function/Category:  University Recruiting 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Part Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG is seeking a Social Media/Digital Analytics Intern at our Newark NJ location.

This position will be supporting the Social Media/Digital Analytics in the Customer Technology area. This team works in our social media channels, mostly Facebook and Twitter, and responds to customer inquiries and concerns. We strive to help every customer that reaches out to us in a timely manner. The other responsibility of the team are digital analytics. All the digital channel analytics are developed and maintained in this group. We work mainly with Google Analytics 360 and Sitecore Analytics as well as SAP and Salesforce.

Job Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:

• Monitor social media channels for customer needs and brand concerns.

• Perform routine social media tagging, user management, and conversation management tasks

• Testing new website tagging and maintaining tagging documentation for Google Analytics and Sitecore Analytics

• Assist digital product teams test system changes, particularly with regard to the analytics associated with each product

• Propose and collaborate on the creation of content for digital products, subject to review and approval

• Support our understanding of customer behavior on digital channels through reporting and analytics

• Optimization Techniques - Personalization and A/B testing

Required Education/Skills: The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Computer Science, Marketing, Communications, Alalytics, or similar related major. Candidates must have completed sophomore level course work for consideration. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Desired:
• Interest in Digital Channel Analytics - such as Google Analytics
• Superior written and verbal communication skills
• Highly collaborative, able to work across business units to achieve desired outcomes
• Prior experience running reports using common tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Access
• Proficiency in MS Word and PowerPoint

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions. Candidates are expected to work 40 hours per week over the summer period for the full 10-12 week period. We are targeting: Currently enrolled students wi, staying in the NJ/NY/PA metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions.As an employee of PSE&G or PSEG Long Island, you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations.

Nearest Secondary Market: New York City
Job Segment: Intern, ERP, Computer Science, SAP, Compliance, Entry Level, Technology, Legal

HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?

 

At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.

 

The
Henkel Corporation is offering an internship program for 2018 through its
Research & Development division. The program offers numerous opportunities
for those interested in pursuing careers in technology development,
specifically in the areas of product formulation for beauty care
sciences.  Interns accepted into the program will function as part of an
integrated, cross- functional R&D team.

 

BEAUTY FORMULATION SCIENTIST INTERN

 

The Beauty Formulation Scientist Intern will plan and execute specification development for raw materials, formulas and
projects which support the innovation process of the company.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Develop experimental designs and work
    plans in the creation of prototype products and methods.
  • Development and preparation of raw material,
    formula, packaging and finished product specifications.
  • Work closely with cross functional
    R&D teams (formulating, packaging, process development, etc.) in the
    progression of projects
  • Records detailed observation and data
    from experiments performed. Keeps lab notebook records current and in good
    order as a working legal document.
  • Plans and schedules project tasks
    related to laboratory experiments and potential consumer trials.
  • Reports project status to team members
    and management as required.
  • Responsible for safe working conditions
    (handles dangerous equipment and hazardous chemicals).  Is aware of hazards associated with work
    assigned, observes safe work practices, keeps equipment neat, clean and in
    safe
  • operating condition, and maintains good housekeeping standards.
  • Responsible for following all applicable
    Federal, State, and Local health, safety, and environmental regulations,
    as per corporate health, safety and environmental policies.


YOUR SKILLS

  • Demonstrated progress toward a Bachelor’s or advanced degree in chemistry.
  • Basic personal computer skills including word processing, spreadsheets, and databases are required.
  • Strong communication skills are required.
  • Basic knowledge of scientific method and ability to understand and carry out standard methods relevant to the department.
  • Experience required to efficiently perform a variety of research experiments and tests including setting up and operation of apparatus and equipment.

Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and other legally protected characteristics.

Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel’s request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.

All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.

Job Function/Category:  Information Technology 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

IT's vision is to power the digital future of PSEG. We are partners with the business and we are driving business outcomes through innovative use of technology. Our Technology Operations Professional is similar to our Nuclear Operations Professional role except our Technology Operations Professional role is not solely focused on Nuclear's applications and field services support but to all Information Technology systems and applications in various locations in New Jersey and Long Island. This Technology Professional will not require a degreee in Computer Science or STEM field. Thus creating the opportunity to consider candidates with IT experience without a bachelor's degree. These roles are critical as we are insourcing to lead technology solutions and drive business outcomes. This position will lead to other advanced level Information Technology roles such as Associate Business Systems Analyst, Associate Technology Product Consultants through challenging assignments and allowing them to further develop their skills in various areas within Information Technology.

Job Responsibilities

•Responsible for working collaboratively with all stakeholders and serving as a technology leader for the effective use of technologies to maintain world-class operations and delivery of solutions. Develop and deliver technology and information strategy and trends, and best practices/governance •Responsible to keep the environment current and identify continuous improvement areas as well as come up with new initiatives. Identify future technologies and implement new technologies once business approved •Define and build technical and data architectures within PSEG integrated data platform(s). Develop governance that promote data standards. Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, source-to-target maps, and database policies and guidelines •Collaborate with the application developers and database administrators to ensure database performance, integrity and security •Provide other contributions as directed by your Technology Group Product Manager and/or Product Owner

Job Specific Qualifications

Required
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or without a bachelor's degree, internship to 4 years of related IT experience

Desired
•Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (STEM discipline preferred). •Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements •Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management •Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Management or Customer Relationship Management software •Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc. •Prior experience supporting a Windows environment •Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks •Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls •Experience troubleshooting network communications issues with vendors and carriers

Job Function/Category:  Information Technology 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

The technology professional will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems. Technology Professionals will work closely with Business Analysts and Group Product Managers to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and physical design of technical solutions. Candidates must be a graduate of Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) and must have PSEG work experience.

Job Responsibilities

•Analyzes end-user needs and designs, develops and tests software to satisfy demand. Performs build versus buy analysis for business demand. •Partners with business analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provides recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications. •Creates process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develops technical workflows using different modeling techniques. •Collaborates with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware. •Ensures that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect. •Analyzes application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements. •Codes applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area. •Provides daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Applies operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment. •Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules and test activities/results. •Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required Skills:
•Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences preferred, or relevant experience. •Candidates must be a graduate of Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) and must have PSEG work experience. •Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise. •Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services. •Experience working with or related coursework to write software code in both web and client/server environments such as • Software Languages: Java, .Net, C, C++, HTML, XML, SQL, VBA, Node.js, Swift •Operating Systems: Windows, Linux •Relational Databases: SQL Server, Oracle, Aurora, Postgres, MongoDB • Experience designing graphical user interfaces using graphical design tools (e.g. Photoshop, MS Visio) •Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android) •Alexa skill development •MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access •Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively. •Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary. •Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly. •Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills. •Ability to learn new business and technical concepts. •Good written and oral communication skills.

Requisition ID:  65080 

Job Function/Category:  Information Technology 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

As a Technology Professional this role is an entry level role that provides college hires the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills and launch an exciting career in information technology. They will learn and assist in various technology projects and programs such as assisting in the development of processes and procedures related to business continuity and disaster recovery of IT systems. Participating in various projects assisting teams in ensuring systems and infrastructure plan for and incorporate required resiliency to meet business needs for high availability. In this entry level role, the successful candidate will be exposed to various IT technologies and will develop skills related to system design, integration, support and operations.

Job Responsibilities

•As a Sr Technology Professional, this role is a natural growth progression for Technology Professionals who have gained 2 or more years of relevant technology experience. They will provide technical and/or business analysis in support of technology applications or infrastructure. Analyzes simple to moderately complex inquiries and determines appropriate technical area or vendor to resolve problems and makes suggestions for improvements. Responsible for executing smaller projects and/or support tasks and typically maintain a high level of direct client interaction. Works closely with management, clients, other systems technical staff and vendors in problem solving. Consults with the supervisor and IT professionals when the appropriate course of action is unclear or a major problem is suspected. They may be responsible for operating and maintaining production systems, as well as providing hardware/software equipment support. Provides technical support and guidance to client and systems areas through consulting, teaching and publication of documentation with a focus on business continuity and disaster recovery. Participates with client and development areas in the design and implementation of new or modified systems and infrastructure. Assists clients and other IT employees ensuring business continuity is considered and planned for as new are built or existing systems are modified or enhanced. Works with client and IT teams to coordinate, monitor, track and report on disaster recovery testing. Initiates and coordinates corrective actions. Performs related duties as assigned or requested.

Job Specific Qualifications

• Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information/Computer Security, Engineering or STEM.
• Minimum 3.0 GPA
• Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access
• Experience working with or related coursework in .NET, HTML, SQL, Java, Java scripting or Object Oriented Design.
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Desired:

• Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements
• Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management
• Experience designing and maintaining high availability systems or infrastructure including building and maintaining disaster recovery environments.
• Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc.
• Prior experience supporting a Windows environment
• Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks
Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls

position: Local College Co-op - Emergency Services & Security
description:
Dow has an exciting part-time cooperative education job opportunity available in Midland, MI. This position is open to qualified and highly-committed college students enrolled in a fully accredited college or university located very close to the Midland Dow site. Unlike a short-term internship project outside of school terms, this particular role is a long-term, year-round, undergraduate student position -- at least one full year in duration -- while the student is simultaneously taking classes toward an undergraduate degree. This opportunity offers the student valuable professional work experience in a dynamic, multi-national corporation interfacing with colleagues and leaders in many different roles. This program is designed for academically successful students who meet ALL of the specific job and co-op program requirements listed below and who can simultaneously succeed both in school and in a professional work environment.

   

Job Purpose

This position of a Student Security Officer within the Emergency Services & Security (ES&S) department exists to provide security and process the flow of personnel and materials at the gate locations of the Midland area corporate, manufacturing and research locations.

Key Job Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Performing vehicle inspections

  • Effective, professional and helpful communication and conduct with employees, customers, suppliers, etc.

  • Enforcement of security procedures

  • Documentation for visitors and materials in and out of Dow facilities

  • Monitoring/operation security and access control systems, security alarms, badge programming/creation, camera operations, and tracking system for shipping of dry and bulk materials.

Required & Preferred Qualifications

  • Must be pursuing an undergrad degree from a fully accredited college or university near the Dow Midland, MI site.

  • A major in criminal justice or fire science is preferred but not required. 

  • During vehicle inspections, the student must be able to climb in and out of vehicles, including semi-trucks.

  • Depending on the shift that is available, there is a potential to work a shift other than a day shift.

  • The student will periodically need to operate a vehicle during their assignment; therefore, a valid driver's license and safe driving is required.

  • During winter months, salting and shoveling the sidewalks are also required.

  • Candidates must have good interpersonal skills.

  • Candidates must be able to multitask during emergency and normal operational situations and have the ability to change priorities as needed.

  • Teamwork and cooperation are essential, as well as taking independent initiative on things that need to be done.

  • Candidates must be knowledgeable with computers and Microsoft applications, especially using Word, Excel and Outlook.

Critical Requirements of the Local Student Co-Op Program

  • High school diploma/GED and already enrolled at an accredited college or university located close to the Midland Dow site, pursuing an undergraduate degree.

  • Successfully complete a minimum of 6 credit hours per term during both the Fall and Winter terms (~Sept-Apr).

  • Seeking high performing student with strong GPAs of 3.000+; however, a minimum 2.700+ term and cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale is required at ALL times – both to enter and to continue working in the Dow co-op program.  Attach a screen capture from your school’s website or a copy of your most recent transcripts/grade report showing classes and recent GPAs to this application.  Eligibility to continue in this cooperative education program is checked every term.

  • Able to begin work very soon, usually within 3 weeks of the job offer, and work year-round at least 20 hours each week ONLY during our regular business hours (8am-5pm, Mon-Fri…max 8 hours/day and 30/week during school).

  • Commit to the role for at least 1 full calendar year (BEFORE completing classes for your stated undergraduate degree or BEFORE transferring out of the area).  Students available longer than one year before completing their degree program are preferred and advantaged. 

  • Reliable attendance and punctuality in commuting to work daily or at least 3 days a week; therefore, dependable transportation, dedication and time management skills are absolutely required. 

  • Registered/enrolled in their school's Cooperative Education Program before the first day at Dow and comply with the school’s policies/requirements, in addition to Dow's, for the duration of co-op employment. 

  • Any current Dow college co-ops wishing to transfer into this role must have been in their current role at least one full year, must have at least one full year left before graduating or transferring out of the area, and must have supervisor approval before applying to each Dow co-op job posting.

Candidates who receive a job offer will be required to pass a background check and drug screen/medical evaluation and will verify school-related requirements and I-9 documentation before being hired into Dow.

A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States.  No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

About Dow

 

Dow (NYSE: DOW) combines global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation and leading business positions to achieve profitable growth. The Company’s ambition is to become the most innovative, customer centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company, with a purpose to deliver a sustainable future for the world through our materials science expertise and collaboration with our partners. Dow’s portfolio of plastics, industrial intermediates, coatings and silicones businesses delivers a broad range of differentiated science-based products and solutions for its customers in high-growth market segments, such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer care. Dow operates 106 manufacturing sites in 31 countries and employs approximately 35,700 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately $39 billion in 2020. References to Dow or the Company mean Dow Inc. and its subsidiaries. For more information, please visit www.dow.com or follow @DowNewsroom on Twitter.


 As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Dow is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at http://www.dow.com/en-us/contact-us or you may call us at 1-800-523-3945.

ABOUT US

Sanctuary for Families is New York's leading service provider and advocate for survivors of domestic violence, sex trafficking and related forms of gender violence. Every year, Sanctuary empowers thousands of adults and children to move from fear and abuse to safety and stability, transforming lives through a comprehensive range of services. We provide a range of wrap-around services to help survivors rebuild their lives in the aftermath of abuse, and work to end gender violence through three key strategies: direct services, outreach and training, and systems-change advocacy. Our services are available in 11 locations throughout New York City.

Supervisory experience or experience in directing the work of volunteers and interns is desirable

- Ability to adapt to and understand different environments and constituencies

Habitat for Humanity Wake County is currently seeking a talented professional for the Directory of Advocacy position.
Reporting to the President/CEO, the Director of Advocacy is responsible for leading the affiliate’s advocacy efforts by promoting policies and systems that eliminate barriers to affordable housing. The Director of Advocacy will lead the department in conducting public education and awareness activities to highlight the importance of housing affordability in our community and build political will for change.

Policy advocacy and governmental affairs:

Provide leadership in setting and implementing Habitat Wake’s advocacy agenda, policy priorities, and strategy.
Lead Habitat Wake’s policy advocacy efforts, which are primarily focused at the local/regional level with some engagement at state and national levels in collaboration with Habitat North Carolina and Habitat for Humanity International.
Champion Habitat Wake’s participation in HFHI’s Cost of Home national advocacy campaign.
Guide Habitat Wake’s involvement in Habitat NC’s and Habitat for Humanity International (HFHI)’s state, national and global housing policy efforts.
Build and maintain strong relationships with local, state, and national policymakers to position Habitat Wake as a trusted advisor on housing issues.
Support the development review processes for Habitat Wake projects and mobilize the network to contact elected officials in support when needed.

Public awareness and education:

Speak on behalf of Habitat Wake to promote its advocacy agenda in collaboration with the CEO.
Raise awareness for equitable housing policies and call out systems that perpetuate the need for Habitat, especially through a racial justice lens.
Partner with the Communications department to set advocacy communications strategy, including key messaging, media, public relations, and online engagement.
Position Habitat Wake as a thought leader and resource on affordable housing, especially regarding homeownership
Educate policymakers and community leaders on housing policy and issues affecting Habitat Wake’s ability to further its mission.

Community partnerships:

Forge partnerships with organizations across the housing continuum so that all may work together to advance access to housing affordability.
Provide leadership for Wake Affordable Housing Coalition (WAHC) in its efforts to promote local housing solutions through a shared agenda.

Grassroots mobilizing:

Lead efforts to engage Habitat Wake’s constituency with housing advocacy messages and present opportunities for stakeholders to take action.
Facilitate Habitat Wake’s involvement in network-wide advocacy events, including Habitat NC Legislative Day, Habitat NC Week of Action, Habitat on the Hill, World Habitat Day, etc.
Recruit board members, advocacy committee and homebuyers to participate in HFHI’s national lobby day, Habitat on the Hill.
Work with the Homeownership Services team to empower homebuyers and neighborhood residents to become housing advocates.
Partner with the Faith Relations department to engage faith coalitions in advocacy from a faith-based justice perspective

Research and analysis:

Oversee research activities to provide analysis that supports the public awareness and policy objectives of the organization.

Strategic planning and departmental leadership:

Set the strategy for Habitat Wake’s advocacy initiatives in collaboration with the Advocacy Committee and CEO.
Represent the advocacy function on Habitat Wake’s senior leadership team.
Supervise the Advocacy Coordinator role and other staff/intern/volunteer positions within the department.
Manage department budget and track expenditures.
Report advocacy metrics and progress on a monthly basis.
Develop monthly reports for the Advocacy Committee and Board of Directors.
Engage in strategic planning to set annual objectives within the context of Habitat Wake’s organizational goals.

Advocacy Committee:

Lead the Advocacy Committee in shaping Habitat Wake’s advocacy agenda and setting annual policy priorities that guide the affiliates advocacy work.
Recruit for the Advocacy Committee and onboard new members.
Work with the Advocacy Committee chair to set meeting agendas.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:

5+ years of experience in advocacy, government relations, public affairs and/or awareness campaigns aimed at influencing policy change.
Knowledge of affordable housing issues and policy at the local, state and/or national level
Experience developing and managing efforts to influence policymakers and external stakeholders.
Ability to think strategically and use judgement in decision-making.
Prioritize work to meet objectives when balancing multiple projects with differing deadlines, importance, and stakeholders.
Strong relational, analytical, writing, and verbal skills for communicating with diverse populations.
Ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with Habitat Wake staff, Advocacy Committee, community partners, and policymakers.
Ability to organize work and time while working efficiently and effectively in an office with frequent interruptions.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team and with great energy and persistence.
Excellent public relations skills with a passion for the organization’s mission.
Critical thinking, problem solving, accuracy and attention to detail.
Experience effectively managing a team.
Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite, Office 365, and virtual meeting platforms, Asana project management software.
Familiarity with data sets such as U.S. Census, Comprehensive Housing Affordability Strategy (CHAS), HUD Income Limits, HUD Fair Market Rents (FMR) preferred.
Willingness to pursue ongoing training (e.g. affordable housing & advocacy) and professional development.
Bachelor’s degree in political science, public affairs, public policy, communications, or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

position: Staff Engineer, Process Technology Development R&D
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA
 


 


Summary:  
The Staff Engineer uses process engineering and food science principles to lead process development research projects and programs.  One key focus area of current research will be leadership of chocolate process development research related to better for you initiatives and sugar reduction, from benchtop to pilot scale, and commercialization supporting both ingredient development and finished product.  Additionally, he/she will lead program technical strategy development, project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.  The successful candidate will be leading projects of higher complexity and apply technical rigor to ensure project goals and business objectives are achieved.  He/she will need to be able to prioritize his/her work and contribute to strategic directions within R&D.  He/she will progress technical research, by disciplined application of the scientific method through the project management process and the transfer of knowledge to Product Development, Commercialization and/or Operations teams. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required.  In addition to working with R&D team members, the staff engineer is expected to be able to work along side our cross-functional partners in Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality and other Supply Chain  departments as well as our M&A partners. The successful candidate will report to the group’s Principal Engineer. 


 


Summary of major duties:



  • Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities. 

  • Lead chocolate process technology development worksteams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which may focus on BFY chocolate process development.

  • Lead complex process development and process validation to support product commercialization in various areas for the Hershey Company.

  • Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations.

  • Determine next steps through problem solving. 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies. 

  • Have a good understanding of current processing technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough technologies.

  • Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D. 

  • Provide leadership and instruction to technicians. 

  • Ability to connect and interact with peers from other within and other industries  to exchange information and ideas in area of expertise where appropriate.


 


Process development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation



  • Operate or direct the operation of lab or pilot-plant equipment in the

  • performance of  tests or experiments. Lead the development of new 

  • processes through research and experimentation to deliver project results.

  • Hands-on work involving running lab, pilot plant and factory equipment.   



Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation  



  • Design and execute experiments, analyze data and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required.  Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.



Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:  
•    Experience leading a cross-functional team in a development of new process and/or technologies. 
•    Sound technical knowledge and capability of applying knowledge to research projects. 
•    Understanding of the fundamentals of chocolate including formulations, manufacturing, forming, and downstream processes. 
•    Understanding of the impact of the key processing parameters in the conversion of raw ingredient and in-process material to finished product. 
•    Demonstrated excellence in project leadership and decision making ability.
•    Comfortable with operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment. 
•    Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
•    Demonstrated mathematical and statistical skills. 
•    Possesses computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)
•    Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities. 



Minimum Education and Experience Requirements: 
Education: BS degree in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Food Science, Chemistry, or related field required.
Experience: 5-10+ years (B.S. food/engineering degree) or 3-5+ years (M.S.) in R&D environment  in process development, process validation, food engineering.  Intern and prior research project work will be considered. 
Experience in chocolate processing is a plus.

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

IT's vision is to power the digital future of PSEG. We are partners with the business and we are driving business outcomes through innovative use of technology. Our Technology Operations Professional is similar to our Nuclear Operations Professional role except our Technology Operations Professional role is not solely focused on Nuclear's applications and field services support but to all Information Technology systems and applications in various locations in New Jersey and Long Island. This Technology Professional will not require a degreee in Computer Science or STEM field. Thus creating the opportunity to consider candidates with IT experience without a bachelor's degree. These roles are critical as we are insourcing to lead technology solutions and drive business outcomes. This position will lead to other advanced level Information Technology roles such as Associate Business Systems Analyst, Associate Technology Product Consultants through challenging assignments and allowing them to further develop their skills in various areas within Information Technology.

Job Responsibilities

•Responsible for working collaboratively with all stakeholders and serving as a technology leader for the effective use of technologies to maintain world-class operations and delivery of solutions. Develop and deliver technology and information strategy and trends, and best practices/governance •Responsible to keep the environment current and identify continuous improvement areas as well as come up with new initiatives. Identify future technologies and implement new technologies once business approved •Define and build technical and data architectures within PSEG integrated data platform(s). Develop governance that promote data standards. Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, source-to-target maps, and database policies and guidelines •Collaborate with the application developers and database administrators to ensure database performance, integrity and security •Provide other contributions as directed by your Technology Group Product Manager and/or Product Owner

Job Specific Qualifications

Required
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or without a bachelor's degree, internship to 4 years of related IT experience

Desired
•Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (STEM discipline preferred). •Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements •Knowledge of testing methodologies and/or project management •Familiarity with Enterprise Resource Management or Customer Relationship Management software •Certifications in technical specialties such as Microsoft, Cisco, etc. •Prior experience supporting a Windows environment •Familiarity with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP networks •Knowledge of Sarbanes Oxley controls •Experience troubleshooting network communications issues with vendors and carriers

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

Our Technology Professional role is an entry level role that provides the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills in windows and DBA. This Position is a direct report to Senior Technology Infrastructure Supervisor within IT System Services. Network Operations are 24x7 shift rotation work and overtime work may be required. Candidates must be a graduate of Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) and must have PSEG work experience.

Job Responsibilities

•Learn network/LAN design and implementation for data and converged communications infrastructure based largely on Cisco equipment networking technologies. Participate in Network improvement projects and provide support services to assist internal client organizations in the pursuit of their business objectives. Participate in requirements gathering, solutions design, systems configuration and development for a variety of Networking, cloud and wireless solutions. •Acquire wireless and mobile technology skills in a highly collaborative organization. Participate in network, security and wireless projects and improve productivity of internal client organizations and customers by deploying new hardware technology solutions focused on a combination of on premises and cloud based implementations. •Work as a team member on projects related to network security and firewall improvement implementations. Participate in requirements gathering, solution design, testing and moving new systems into production. •Learn to execute Infrastructure projects through the PSEG's Project Development Life Cycle (PDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the hardware design, test and implementation process.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required:
• Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information/Computer Security, Engineering or a related STEM discipline.
• Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access)
• Self-starter with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Other:
• PSEG will not offer visa sponsorship in connection with this position.
• Candidate must have a valid driver's license and be willing to travel within the state of NJ and to PSEG Long Island locations.
• Network Operations are 24x7 shift rotation work and overtime work may be required.

Education

Bachelor in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

Bachelors in Information Technology or Information/Computer Security

Job Summary

This is an entry level role that provides college hires the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills the areas of Customer Care, and Call Center technologies such as Salesforce, MuleSoft and emerging technologies. This position is a direct report to IT Group Product Managers of Smart Services.

This is a multi-level position in PSEG's Information Technology department. The title and level assigned to the successful candidate will be determined by assessing skills, knowledge and related experience, learned through the interview process. For a Technology Professional must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and internship to 2 years of technology experience. For a Sr Technology Professional, must have 2 years or more years of technology experience

Job Responsibilities

•This position provides opportunity to be involved several product developments:

• Develop and support Digital Customer Channels. Participate in requirements gathering, solutions design, systems configuration and development for a variety of products such as Alexa, Google Home, Mobile App and MyAccount.

• Learn to execute projects through the PSEG's Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the application design, test and implementation process using Agile and 2 Pizza concepts.

• Work with Product teams in Two Pizza Team approach similar to Amazon product development and CICD model.

• Develop and implement process improvements, Next Best Actions, Automation opportunities, and Pro-active communications for customer care applications.

• Become a subject matter expert (aka Product Consultant) for technical and solution architecture that will include configuration, development, integration, and customization of digital channel products.

Other:
• PSEG will not offer visa sponsorship in connection with these positions. Positions will be located in Newark, New Jersey in the PSEG General Office.
• Candidate must be able to travel within the State of NJ and to our PSEG Long Island locations.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required:
•• Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information/Computer Security, Engineering or a related technical discipline i.e. STEM.
• Mininmum years of experience of internship of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• This is a multi-level position and placement is dependent upon skills, knowledge and experience of the selected candidate.
o Technology Professional - must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and internship
o Sr Technology Professional - must have 2 years or more years of technology experience
• Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access)
• Programming Experience working with or related coursework .NET, HTML, SQL, C, C++, Java, JavaScript, NODE.JS, JQuery, REST API's, JSON, Angular or Object Oriented Design,
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.
• Candidate must foster an inclusive work environment and respect all aspects of diversity. Successful candidate must demonstrate and value differences in others' strengths, perspectives, approaches, and personal choices.
Desired:

• Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements
• Knowledge of Agile development and project management
• Certifications in technical specialties such as AWS, Mobile application development is desired
• Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android)
• Alexa skill development

• Learn Salesforce and Deploy solutions. Job Specific Qualifications

• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Required for Sr Technology Professional - DBA:

• Experience with Database Performance Tuning and Monitoring
• Experience with Database Backup and Recovery
• Experience with System Monitoring
• Understanding of Database Disaster Recovery (DR) Practices and Architectures
• Familiarity with tools - EMC Networker, OEM, OID, Tripwire
• Experience with Linux and Windows, and networking concepts such as IP network
• Familiarity with Oracle RAC and / or Microsft SQL Server Always On
• Knowledge of Sarbanes-Oxley controls
• Familiarity with automation technologies - Ansible, Python, Scripting, PowerShell etc.

Desired:

• Experience with mySQL, PostgreSQL.
• Experience with System Monitoring, i.e., Microsoft Systems Center
• Experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL.
• Experience working with databases that are clustered and attached to a SAN infrastructure.
• Experience with DB2.
• Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL certifications.
• ITILv3 Foundations certifications

Job description


Summary of Job Purpose:


Internship opportunity to work with a team to execute specific projects and receive on the job training while gaining professional experience.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:o This person will work with executive leadership to understand and define requirements of our leadership management system and process in order to tailor our IT tools to support simple, effective, and efficient monitoring and control of our key performance indicators (KPIs). Our management system includes a regular process to set goals, measure performance against those goals, and take action to control our performance. These KPIs include such things as sales, gross margin, R&D spend, staffing, on-time delivery, quality, and more.o This work can be broken up into discrete projects, which can be started and completed during this internship.o This position will also work with leadership to lay out the vision and roadmap of future expansion of the IT tools and management system to meet the business needs.o This person will also work with others across different sites in Southern California, Texas, and Mexico to ensure their underlying KPI's are consumable by the IT tools for the Executive Leadership KPI's and management system.o Current IT tools include SAP, Power BI, excel, powerpoint, and we welcome additional recommendations.o This role will also include the rollout and training of users

Officeo While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.o The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.o The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.




Job requirements


Required Competencies:


Education / Experience:o Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering or Computer Scienceo Legally authorized to work in the US without company sponsorshipo This position requires use of information or access to hardware, which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugeeo Fulfill all Environmental, Safety & Health requirements and act in a safe and environmentally responsible manner at all times. This includes, following all ES&H policies and procedures, acting on unsafe conditions and aiding Leadership in the attainment of ES&H initiatives and continuous improvement efforts.


Skills and Abilities:o Strong Mathematics and Statistics knowledgeo Excellent oral and written communication skillso Dependability - Ensures that all details of a project are accurate before delegating to others.o Detail Orientation - Rarely makes errors but accepts responsibility for those that are made and develops a plan to prevent similar errors from recurring.o Listening - Consistently practices attentive and active listening and can accurately restate the opinions of others.o Relationships - Develops relationships with others that are based on trust.o Time Management - Works from a daily to-do list but will re-organize if priorities suddenly shift. Ability to make timely decisions even if the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness




Company information Safran Electronics & Defense


Safran is an international high-technology group, operating in the aviation (propulsion, equipment and interiors), defense and space markets. Its core purpose is to contribute to a safer, more sustainable world, where air transport is more environmentally friendly, comfortable and accessible. Safran has a global presence, with 79,000 employees and sales of 16.5 billion euros in 2020 and holds, alone or in partnership, world or regional leadership positions in its core markets. Safran undertakes research and development programs to maintain the environmental priorities of its R&T and Innovation roadmap.


Safran ranks first in Forbes's 2020 list of the World's Best Employers for its sector.


Safran Electronics & Defense is a world leading supplier of products and services that handle observation, decision and guidance functions for both civil and military applications. The company understands and applies a wide range of the state-of-the-art technologies that underpin embedded intelligence in many different areas, as a supplier to some of today's most innovative aerospace and defense programs.
